place.name: Arroyo Quemado Transect 5
place.geographicDescription: Bedrock substrate, some moderate relief (0-1.5 m), one small overhanging ridge with sand channels and Diopatra beds. Depth is approximately 33 feet.
place.completeDescription: Located ~90m @180 degrees from T4-0m. Bedrock substrate, some moderate relief (0-1.5m), one small overhanging ridge at 30m, with sand channels and Diopatra beds on very flat bottom. Bumpers present at 0 and 40m. 16m marker is SS ¼” eyebolt, all other markers are rebar stakes with tubing. 0m has both old and new rebar. Transect heading is 90-100 degrees.

verbatim.notesInfoReceived: Transect direction is an average over entire transect.
11 MAPY; 1 PTCA; 0 MPJ; little to no red algae.
